name: Maumee Bay Lodge and Conference Center

reviews.text: We were pleasantly surprised with this location. At first we worried that we would run out of things to do here but after a quick check-in we realized that we may run out of time before we got to see all there was to do.
reviews.title: Unexpected gem

reviews.text: We were there over 4th July for 3 nights and were with 2 young ones (2yrs and 4mos) as well as our elderly mother. It was great! We were able to request baby pack and plays for both kids, there was a "gym" suitable for our 2yr old where he could run and jump and not worry about being hurt.
reviews.title: Awesome stop for families. Lots to enjoy.

reviews.text: There was an indoor pool that had fountains that gave us hours of entertainment not to mention the paddle boats and rentable bikes. The place was great.
reviews.title: Not the Most Welcoming Place

reviews.text: The other bonus was that the resort welcomed outdoor food and furnished the rooms with fridges/freezer. We were able to buy fruit and have it in the morning without hassle of getting to the restaurant.
reviews.title: How can you NOT enjoy it?
Cottages need updated and cleaned!!
reviews.text: We hope to make it an annual affair and may have friends join us at the campground nearby.

Our family loves Maumee Resort and the quiet refuge from busy life it provides. Our children especially love the nature center on site and exploring all the books, games and animals inside. The small playground served as a great spot for excess energy and the walking loops -- great! We saw deer in the nature loop nearly every day of our stay. The drive to downtown to Toledo and back was pretty easy and the hotel staff was very good at giving us area pointers. The hotel rooms are average and we think it's worth it to stay out in the cottages if you can. We were pleasantly surprised by how good the food in the restaurant tasted. We thought it was a bit pricey, however. The kids also enjoyed gathering for movie night and popcorn at the hotel "family room".
reviews.title: Learn, Fun, Relax

likes.liked: — The nature loop and walking trails.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you have previously stayed at state park resorts in the Midwest, you’ll probably give this one a good rating. The rooms are spacious, with nice views of Lake Erie. The public areas are modern and impressive. However, our room’s balcony was unusable due to spiders (Albeit a common problem on Lake Erie), and the grounds looked like they could’ve used some TLC. Service and food in the restaurant was fair, at best.
reviews.title: Nice, clean, but not perfect
Nice place to stay
reviews.text: This was just a stopover for my wife and I, so our expectations might have been different than families or larger groups may have for longer stays. For those folks, the amenities, activities, and reasonable prices available may well overshadow any of the minor issues we had with the resort.

reviews.title: Not a quiet winter getaway or a romantic one
reviews.text: If you are going to Maumee Bay for the first time then you should stay here. There are special packages avaiable. Look into it. The raquet ball courts, ping pong and pool are cool. Worth a 2 nite stay to relax and see lake Erie and walk a trail or two.
G Man
reviews.title: Nice place to vacation
Great to be on Lake Erie...
reviews.text: Having heard over the years some great comments about Maumee Bay Resort thought we would spend a winter weekend there- when the rates were on package specials- and with a chance of snow to possibly get in some cross-country skiing...

reviews.title: Cottages could use some work!
reviews.text: We booked a king room- which literally overlooked Lake Erie and we enjoyed a nearly private view as the temperatures were in the 20's !! We got to see it snow on Lake Erie too. The room was comfortable and had it's own mini-refridgerator which was very nice.Had a problem with the bathroom as it smelled very bad.. unfortunately the room attendants arrived and instead of "mopping it down" used a room spray on the floor and walls. It was effective -but would have preferred a better cleaning. There was only slight cleaning as well during our 3 nights stay-and trash cans were not emptied, coffee carafe not cleaned- we did this ourselves etc. Basically they came in and changed the towels and made the bed. On the up side.. there wasn't enough snow- so we did use the pool, hot tub- too hot, sauna, and excersise room. We also played ping-pong.
There is a nice nature center on the premises and a "board walk" trail through the woods- lovely with the ice and snow- plus saw a lot of white
reviews.title: Cottages a great place to stay!
Perfect Family Getaway!
reviews.text: tailed deer close up who wandered in the woods.

reviews.title: Relaxation, great food & clean air!
reviews.text: The dining room had a gourmet menu and we really enjoyed the food.There was also a cocktail lounge and beer and wine available. As it

The location and setting were quite nice. While checking in, on the arm of a nearby lobby sofa a set of parents wrestling with a young boy, their son, we assume. The process continued throughout our check in time. I asked what was going on, only to get shruggs and head tilts, like we don't know. Welcome to Maumee Resort! Unescorted children are everywhere, reunion type pizza parties in the main lobby, tasteless ice cream off the lobby, motel like accommodations, slow and unprofessional service in the restaurant, but they have a Starbucks kiosk outside the restaurant!!! Not served inside. Like checking into a trailer park. As you get on the elevator, look to your left in the guest laundry, you'll see the latest in ghetto hair services demonstrated while you wait!
reviews.title: Look elsewhere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I could not disagree with the previous posters more. The room was spotless, the view of the lake and fountain was spectacular, the staff were congenial and professional from the Pool Bartender (Jeff B) to the hostess and waitresses in the WatersEdge. I'm not sure that I see a problem with "outsiders" using certain facilities (the pool is restricted to Quilter Lodge guests and verified via wristbands) since it is a State Park, supported by all Ohio residents.
reviews.title: Fantastic Weekend

reviews.text: I cannot think of an activity that is not available at the Resort or close by - swimming, fishing, jetski rental, two well maintained beaches, shuffleboard, horeshoes, nature trails, tennis courts, racquetball courts, spacious outdoor pool, really cool indoor pool, basketball courts, sand volleyball court, a marina, an amphitheater with live music on Saturdays, and tons of activities and play areas for kids - I could go on and on. To top it off, I almost forgot the "world class" Scottish links golf course - something that every golfer has to experience.
reviews.title: great in past, but now run-down

reviews.text: All of this for a room base rate of $178 for two doubles lake view - I don't know what resorts the other posters visit, but this is a bargain - for the amenities listed above the going rate is close to $300 per night or more.
reviews.title: Nice location

reviews.text: And the food was exquisite for all meal types. We were scouting the Lodge for a potential large family gathering next year - our expectations were far exceeded and we now have the task of translating our wonderful experience into enthusiasm for the family.
reviews.title: Loved the cottages!

description: Situated on the shores of Lake Erie and only 15 minutes east of downtown Toledo, Maumee Bay Lodge and Conference Center is a full-service resort-style property offering an array of amenities, activities and recreational opportunities: marina, championship golf course, swimming pools, boardwalk, biking trails, racquetball courts, tennis, small boat rentals, hiking trails, and more. All 120 modern guestrooms have a private balcony/patio and provide spectacular views of the surrounding park. The 24 cottages feature fireplaces and modern amenities. Meeting facilities are available for corporate events, reunions, church retreats and wedding receptions. The Water's Edge Restaurant is suitable for a special occasion or family outing.
